facts: A smartphone has more computing power than the computers NASA used to help land astronauts on the Moon in 1969.
GPS works by timing signals from multiple satellites, and your device uses those tiny time differences to calculate your location.
The first text message ever sent in 1992 simply said "Merry Christmas."
Wi-Fi is a type of radio signal, similar to how a walkie-talkie sends information through the air.
Many websites use encryption (like HTTPS) to scramble data so others cannot easily read it while it travels across the internet.
A QR code can store information in two directions (up-down and left-right), which helps it hold more data than a normal barcode.
Some computers use solid-state drives (SSDs) with no moving parts, making them faster and more durable than older spinning hard drives.
